case_vignette: A 13-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a 4-month history of worsening dizziness, nausea, and feeling clumsy. An MRI of the brain shows a well-demarcated, 4-cm cystic mass in the posterior fossa. The patient undergoes complete surgical resection of the mass. Pathologic examination of the surgical specimen shows parallel bundles of cells with eosinophilic, corkscrew-like processes.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
